image.altText: A man hold up a light to a large hole in the ceiling, debris all over the kitchen counter and floor

props.synopsis: Thousands of residents were faced with outages in the South Australian town of Port Pirie after a severe thunderstorm and hail destroyed roofs as well as bringing down trees and powerlines.

title.children: SA town experiences "most significant storm event" on record

image.altText: An overhead view of an outback spring.

props.synopsis: The Great Artesian Basin covers a fifth of Australia and contains water that has been there for millions of years. Now, decades of extraction are taking their toll and traditional owners are fighting a mining giant for compensation.

title.children: Water is under pressure in the Great Artesian Basin

image.altText: A woman in a white shirt sitting in a wheelchair on a ramp at the back of a vehicle next to a man in a checked shirt

props.synopsis: When there are so few taxis in your regional city that you can actually use, it can be detrimental to your independence when it no longer shows up.

title.children: City's only wheelchair taxi missing in action leaving customers in limbo

image.altText: A wide shot of Mount Gambier's Blue Lake.

props.synopsis: Most lakes are kind of blue, but this lake in South Australia stands out for its super-bright colour that attracts tourists from around the country. But just why it is so blue and why it changes colour during the year are not well known.

title.children: Why is Mount Gambier's Blue Lake so blue?

image.altText: A screen with YouTube on it. A person hands appear, blurred, near the screen. The background is bright pink and blue.

props.synopsis: BTN High tests what YouTube content will be viewable without an account ahead of next month's social media ban, as an academic says the restrictions are unlikely to change what young people are watching.

title.children: Will teens without accounts be safe on YouTube under social media ban?

image.altText: The SA flag flies above South Australia's Parliament House.

props.synopsis: Four and a half years after a landmark review into sexual harassment, South Australia's Parliament has been accused of moving at a "glacial pace" on workplace reforms, with a new report revealing staff concerns about power imbalances and a "deeply ingrained culture of favouritism".

title.children: Favouritism, fear and double standards: SA Parliament's culture under fire

image.altText: An extreme close-up of a parasite.

props.synopsis: The deadly bee parasite has been detected in South Australia again — this time in the state's south-east.

title.children: Varroa mite found at second site in South Australia

image.altText: A Brisbane Lions AFL player poses for the cameras with his premiership medal, kneeling next to his wife and son.

props.synopsis: Adelaide could not satisfy Brisbane in the AFL trade negotiations for Callum Ah Chee, but finally land the target through the pre-season draft.

title.children: Crows land flag star Ah Chee as players earn AFL lifelines

image.altText: Ben Stokes holds his hat

props.synopsis: As England counts the cost of its first Ashes Test defeat, questions over how its world-beating pace attack was rendered so impotent and its high-class batters so comprehensively lost the plot will rumble all the way to Brisbane.

title.children: England's batting was 'unacceptable' in Perth. It might not get better

image.altText: A man without a shirt wearing a blue hat poses for a photo by a lake with kids.

props.synopsis: Olympic gold medal-winning swimmer Kyle Chalmers is inspiring young and aspiring athletes, and speaking about the importance of mental health.

title.children: Olympic gold medalist swaps coast for the outback on mental health tour

image.altText: A man stares sombrely at the camera while reaching for his firefighting uniform.

props.synopsis: Country Fire Service volunteer Shaun Arnold says verbal abuse from the public is causing some volunteers to quit, a reality he does not want this fire danger season.

title.children: Country firies receiving 'a lot of abuse' from motorists plead for respect

image.altText: person holding a dead baby dolphin

props.synopsis: Adelaide's stormwater network has been discharging high loads of sediment into the Gulf of St Vincent for decades, killing off seagrasses that are a key defence against blooms of the kind wreaking havoc in South Australia.

title.children: Is Adelaide's stormwater contributing to the algal bloom crisis?

image.altText: Graphic image of a baby being handed from one peron to another

props.synopsis: What happens to gender equality when the childcare system meant to support working parents becomes a source of fear?

title.children: An impossible choice: Protect your child or save your future

image.altText: A woman in a blazer smiles as she talks to a man.

props.synopsis: Amelia Hamer has been endorsed as the Liberal Party's candidate for the state seat of Malvern at Victoria's 2026 election.

title.children: Former federal Liberal candidate Amelia Hamer wins preselection for Malvern

image.altText: The big four banks

props.synopsis: We need to beef up the Department of Treasury and let it take on Australia's oligopolies, a new think tank says.

title.children: Treasury should take on Australia's oligopolies, new think tank says

image.altText: Images from a protest rally in a park near a parliament building.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government has taken a "leaf out of the Trump White House" by "smearing opponents" to the proposed Hobart AFL stadium, according to a rally against the project.

title.children: Protest against Hobart stadium attendance numbers rubbished by Premier

image.altText: Bunk beds without mattresses. One in the foreground has a pile of clothes or other items on it.

props.synopsis: More than 300 students have been kidnapped in Nigeria's worst school abduction in 10 years, days after a deadly assault on a church service.

title.children: What is behind Nigeria's latest school kidnappings, church attack?

image.altText: Senator Sarah Hanson-Young sits down for an interview with Insiders host David Speers.

props.synopsis: The ABC has been told the federal government is willing to ensure native forestry complies with tougher new standards within three years if the Greens back the reforms.

title.children: Labor offers Greens forestry deal in exchange for support on environment laws

image.altText: woman standing behind a lectern giving a speech

props.synopsis: Tatiana Schlossberg says the cuts to research made by her cousin RFK Jr, the US Health and Human Services secretary, are disappointing.

title.children: JFK's granddaughter criticises her cousin RFK Jr's policies as health secretary

image.altText: A very close up photo of Trump with a furrowed brow

props.synopsis: Donald Trump believes the US has the right to strike directly at those it accuses of trafficking drugs — even beyond America's borders.

title.children: 'It's OK with me': Trump threatens to send military into Mexico

image.altText: Tom Gleeson on the set of Hard Quiz gesturing behind him with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Spent too much time online shopping this week, and not enough time studying fun facts? Let's see.

title.children: Think you'll nail this week's quiz? I do love some misguided confidence

image.altText: Film still of a very young Mel Gibson wearing a slouch hat

props.synopsis: By the 80s, the story of the Anzacs at Gallipoli had started to fade from the public consciousness. Then an Australian anti-war filmmaker had an idea.

title.children: The Gallipoli story was being forgotten in Australia, until this film

image.altText: A flower farmer holds a wreath as she constructs it.

props.synopsis: Worried you might make a mess, get it wrong or waste your time making a wreath? Read our tips first.

title.children: Make a Christmas wreath with flowers from your garden

image.altText: Jair Bolsonaro stands outside a house and is seen through a gate

props.synopsis: Jair Bolsonaro has been taken into police custody after the country's Supreme Court found he was trying to escape house arrest.

title.children: Brazil's ex-president Jair Bolsonaro arrested over alleged plot to escape

image.altText: A helicopter on a hospital landing pad.

props.synopsis: Paramedics are treating a man in his 60s with significant burns to his limbs, face and chest following a light plane crash in central Queensland.

title.children: Man suffers life-threatening burns in plane crash

image.altText: A man carries a young girl.

props.synopsis: It is not the first time that Israel has carried out similar waves of strikes after reported attacks on its forces during the ceasefire.

title.children: Israel launches strikes in Gaza as hospitals say dozens killed

image.altText: Wallabies players look dejected after a loss during 2025.

props.synopsis: The Wallabies did not turn the corner this year, as many had suggested, as they instead face a daunting challenge to be competitive at the 2027 World Cup.

title.children: Are there any positives to come out of the Wallabies's winless European tour?

image.altText: police tape

props.synopsis: A person has died and four others have been rushed to hospital after a house fire north of Brisbane, with police declaring a crime scene.

title.children: One dead, four others rushed to hospital after north Brisbane house fire

image.altText: Dark military aircrafts viewed head-on on a runway

props.synopsis: The US approval of F-35 sales to Saudi Arabia sparks concerns among human rights groups in Australia, which provides parts and components to build and maintain the fighter jets.

title.children: Calls for Australia F-35 review as US approves jets for Saudi Arabia

image.altText: Anthony Albanese close up

props.synopsis: For most of our federation's history, the two-party system has been an efficient organiser of the population. That has all changed.

title.children: Australians have made the Senate the government's worst nightmare

image.altText: A bird is feeding on water from a watering hole in a black and white night vision video still

props.synopsis: After thousands of hours of recording, the elusive night parrot has been captured on camera drinking from a water hole for the first time, reshaping researchers' understanding of their needs.

title.children: Elusive night parrot filmed drinking water in the Pilbara

image.altText: MediCeram generic

props.synopsis: Malaysian company MediCeram, which previously made moulds for Australian glove-maker Ansell, has denied claims it abused the rights of its Bangladeshi workers.

title.children: Ansell supplier fires migrant workers, causing deportations

image.altText: Luke stands looking out at water, in shadow to disguise him.

props.synopsis: Luke was only minutes into his first shift at his new workplace when he began hearing his colleagues making homophobic comments. Despite being a resident of Australia's most progressive city, he says he no longer feels safe in public.

title.children: Experiences of homophobia 'happening every day' in Australia's most progressive city

image.altText: A young woman with long hair in a white dress sits cross-legged on a bed with a sad expression.

props.synopsis: As the country attempts to close the gaps in pelvic pain research and treatment, Jaali Barton continues to search for help.

title.children: Pelvic pain devastates lives amid vast research gaps

image.altText: male priest wears green liturgical robes holding a silver chalice. another older man in khaki shirt holds out hand to receive

props.synopsis: Without 11 Pacific Islander ministers serving parishes in north Queensland, the region's Anglican church would collapse, according to bishop Keith Joseph.

title.children: How migrant and overseas Christians are helping keep Australian churches alive
